comments.commentBody:
GooGoo Gaga:

A rocumentary highlighting the early days of a pop culture icon.

When the first answer I write in is CAESURA (34 down "Bard's break") I can reasonably predict the rest of the puzzle will be a bear and, sure enough, it was.

While the puzzle was replete with 16 letter entries, which usually means all the necessary short entries will help reveal the sixteen letter answers, the grid layout meant that such was not the case and, to boot, with one or two exceptions, they were not user friendly phrases like we had yesterday.

That summary above is just some lengthy musing on my part which can bode either praise or curses for this one; when the brain strain eases in the morning I'll sort it out.

Tough, as ever, Joe!!

steve l,

Cross references refer to the entry, not the clue. So the EMIRS clue is [Robed commanders]. The image is of desert dress. Judges are not involved.
View is lovely,, If you like champangne this is THE place to go,, service is slow like most of California, but you will be treated well.Enjoy the romance and tranquility!

Mr. Erwitt the Younger has a wonderful eye and upholds the documentary tradition very well. Maybe the flag cries out to be shot in color, but that's not Mr. Erwitt's vision for this project, and other people have certainly done it, though probably not as extensively or as well as Mr. Erwitt has.

Guess what? A person can be intelligent, have a world view, be against stupid wars, and still love their country which is symbolized by our flag. These pseudo-intellectuals who are embarassed by  patriotism make me ill. They are so fakey.

Thank you Mr. Eriwtt: Amazing photographs weaving hope, human fragility and the flag. Each of us projects on a flag and on a photograph what we are, not what it is. To me the flag depicted in the photos is a kind of wallpaper, covering the frayed American experiment. Whatever any of us thinks, thanks go to you the artist. It takes bravery and faith to encourage us to look deeply and to feel. Bravo!
Who is more obtuse: NBC, BP or the warden from Shawshank Redemption?

I understand why they don't pre-empt Today but so let ESPN show it until NBC's window begins. The rerun of a previous match ESPN was forced to show would have been hilarious if it weren't so pathetic. I found the Nadal-Murray match easily online and NBC lost yet another viewer.

I am a big Murray fan and was trying to watch this today and couldn't figure out what was going on until this article explained it to me.

I guess they can change their motto now: NBC the worldwide loser in sports

I think saying it was cheating is overstating it. However, it brought to mind goaltending in basketball, which is of course results in stoppage of play and an automatic basket. Seems futbol might need that sort of rule, in addition to 2 more refs and a real clock.

#17 I have seen this explanation before, and it is not true. The Celtic fan who made the gesture was called a disgrace by his mother and stepfather for taunting Reyna, and other Celtic fans denounced his behavior at the time. A simple Google search will confirm this. He himself claimed that he was drunk and apologized to the club and Reyna (via letter).

I am not a soccer fan, and don't particularly care if Celtic or Rangers ever win another match. I did hear about this incident when it happened, and I checked it out again when I heard Celtic was coming to Boston. I AM a Red Sox fan, and while I'm releaved that there won't be a Rangers-Celtic match at Fenway, I just hope that there will not be any damage/violence from fans of the sides that are coming.
I don't see how a MORTISE is any part of a dovetail. Dovetail joints have "pins," they have "tails," and they have "sockets," but they don't have a "mortise."

I feel horrible for Gyan, who was one of the revelatory players in the tournament, but the rules are clear, and Suarez got just punishment. And PKs are generally converted at higher than 80%. Had Gyan hit his penalty, we would not be having this conversation, plain and simple. Had Mensah and the other kid not hit weak PKs in the shootout, we would not be having this conversation. It is a gutting result, but it is one of those things, and those things happen a lot more often in the World Cup.
I agree with the poster about the heart and grit that Gyan displayed by stepping up for Ghana's first penalty in the shootout and hitting it cleanly. I'm sure he will lose many nights' sleep wishing that he had hit that one for the Extra time PK.
I just wish that Suarez had not celebrated quite so much. Usually, the recipient of a red card tends to be his country's villain of the piece; just ask Beckham about 1998 and Rooney about 2006 and, if you don't mind abuse and maybe violence, ask Diego Maradona how his first World Cup (1982) ended, with a thoroughly merited red card for a knee direct to the groin of Batista of Brazil.

The only positive aspect of this result is that we no longer will have to hear the insufferable Ian Darke drone on about how 'the hopes of an entire continent are with Ghana.' Darke and Harkes were absolutely at their nadir today, and that is a low, low threshhold to cross under.
Martin of DC@30:  Think dovetail as a "fence" of mortises and tenons.  That's my guess as to how the clue was set  up unless Patrick Merrell has a better explanation.

Lord, please no.  The Jets really have something going, based on last season.  To mess it up, and wreck the team chemistry, by bringing in Russell is insane.  The last thing they need now is a "project."  There has got to be a better backup for Sanchez than this.
Just want to say that this analysis is awesome. I love all the detail and careful observation. I don't even care about these teams and I'm reading every one. When are you going to cover the Cowboys?

Pretty good write-up, Andy. We'll have to disagree on Heitmann who I think is one of the better centers in the league. Also, the primary reason so many plays were out of the shotgun was not that Smith is uncomfortable without a clean pocket, but because there was no pocket for many of the plays under the center. The O line did not play well as a unit, and even I was able to predict many of Raye's plays.

Despite the woeful O-lines of the last 5 years, Smith has improved in each of the three seasons where he has started a majority of the games. All he has to do is keep on that improvement trajectory this year, too.

Cursory interest per the USA Today article, synonyms  superficial and shallow; lacking in depth. Cursory suggests a lack of thoroughness or a neglect of details. The Jets, if they are thinking about this could not have spent more than 5 seconds in the thought process; JaMar has made people forget Ryan Leaf. Maybe a 40 million dollar arm but a ten cent head; uh-uh not going to happen.
Nick@29:  Designating a bridge over water as a landmark probably is a red herring.  You just might have a legitimate clue carp.

I just returned from studying abroad at the University of Otago for a semester. Winter is probably not the best time to go, unless you enjoy rain and clouds. Spring and summer (Sept-Feb) are probably best, with autumn also being very beautiful (albeit colder). In my opinion there is no better place to be than Dunedin when it's sunny, but unfortunately (or fortunately, depending on the situation) the weather changes quickly!
Fergburger is probably the best burger place I have ever been to. Simply unbeatable.

Our Istanbul vacation simply could not have been better. Because of the location of this rental we were able to enjoy an authentic experience of what it means to 'be' in another culture. We were located within walking distance to the Spice Bazaar, however the near-by village bakery and Nevi Cafe soon became our favorite spots. There were many quality restaurants within walking distance as well. We truly felt at home in this quaint village and were soon recognized and greeted by the kind locals who allowed us glimpses into their daily lives. The peaceful waterfront park along The Golden Horn awaited us as we walked out of our front door, always a beautiful sight to behold. The apartment itself was lovely, exceptionally clean, and very affordable. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment with kitchen, and bath, located on the second floor which overlooked the village behind us. Mr. Ibo was our gracious host and catered to our needs. I dream of the day we may return to this exact spot and relive the wonderful experience that we found in Istanbul. "
www.istanbulhistoricrentals.com

Not too hard and not too interesting. Sigh.

More white squares ... in a daily NYT ...! Feels like a stretch merely for the sake of a stretch, and what is the payoff? The "and others" crowd -- ERNIES, NEALES, ARLOS -- and the awkward plurals BILES and DRYROTS? Many clever clues to provide cover ... but, alas, ONE'S not feeling the love. So much for pickiness.

comments.userDisplayName: Heart Doctor makes patients wait over 3 hours
comments.commentBody: I had a heart doctor who would make me wait 1 hour to 5 hours for my appointment. Sometimes I would be called to the exam room after an hour or 3 hour or more wait only to sit and wait some more. When I complained to his officemanager about the wait times she would say that they are working on reducing the wait time. Now we are all there to see a heart doctor...getting upset waiting for this guy not only would raise our blood pressures but would also increase the risk of having a possible heart attack right there. After complaining about the constant long waits ( I was there about once eevery 2 weeks) my wait times got longer so I demanded to see another doctor at the same clinic. I was given a new doctor who is wonderful and I am called exactly when my appointment time is. Since then I only have to see a doctor for my heart every 6 months..no more high blood pressure, and my heart no longer hurts every day. The doctor before the new one is just sending me a bill from Jan. 2009. I called to dispute it and told them I reufuse to pay because of all of the many hours he made me wait. He also would have me come in at 9 am and not see me untril 1pm or just send me home. It is a 90 minute trip to his office.  Could someone tell me how to handle this billing issue. I do not think I owe him anything. In fact I think he should pay me for the gas I used to get there, my hours of waiting time and for almost giving me a heart attack.
